alert.note: Alert for Adams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 12:21PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Lewis and Mason. In Ohio, Adams and Brown. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1220 PM EST, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in Lingering high water on some area roadways. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Maysville, Washington, West Union, Manchester, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Lewisburg, Tollesboro, Rome, Concord, Ribolt, Herron Hill, Trinity, Rectorville, Epworth, Orangeburg, Glen Springs, Bradysville and Charters.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
